title: @QuarkusTest does not support constructor injection
body:
### Describe the bug The Kotlin documentation states that you can use constructor injection instead of @Inject annotations. But this does not work for unit tests annotated with @QuarkusTest . With constructor injection the code is more readable because the @Inject variant needs more lines of code (3x). ### Expected behavior The constructor parameters are injected. The test is green. ### Actual behavior An error occurs: > java.lang.RuntimeException: When using constructor injection in a test, the only legal operation is to assign the constructor values to fields. Offending class is class app.restapi.user.UserResourceTest

### How to Reproduce? Try constructor injection for @QuarkusTest tests. Example code (fails): ```kotlin @QuarkusTest class UserResourceTest( private val userService: UserService, private val userDbUtil: UserDbUtil ) { @Test fun test() {} } ``` Example code (works): ```kotlin @QuarkusTest class UserResourceTest { @Inject lateinit var userService: UserService @Inject lateinit var userDbUtil: UserDbUtil @Test fun test() {} } ``` ### Output of `uname -a` or `ver` Darwin name 21.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 21.6.0: Thu Mar 9 20:08:59 PST 2023; root:... ### Output of `java -version` openjdk version "17.0.4" ### GraalVM version (if different from Java) _No response_ ### Quarkus version or git rev 3.1.2.Final ### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`) Maven 3.8.8 ### Additional information Spring Boot supports constructor injection, too: ```kotlin @SpringBootTest class UserResourceTest @Autowired constructor( private val userService: UserService, private val userDbUtil: UserDbUtil ) { fun test() {} } ```
